numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I noticed a fact immediately.
2. For all interaction types, the percentage of young women who reach out to a parent a few times a week is higher than the percentage of young men.
3. The gap is largest for sending texts.
4. The gap is largest for calling on the phone.
5. The difference for in-person visits is much smaller.
6. The difference for in-person visits is about 5 percentage points.
7. Young women are more likely to communicate via text than via any other method.
8. Young men are more likely to communicate via text than via any other method.
9. I wonder why more women than men are willing to reach out to their parents.
10. Girls may form stronger bonds with their parents.
11. I text my parents close to every day.
12. I call my parents close to every day.
13. I text my parents to check in with them briefly.
14. I call my parents to check in with them briefly.
15. This is the case for me.
16. Some college students no longer see their parents daily.
17. Some college students might not communicate with their parents frequently.
18. If a college student is busy with classes, then the college student might not communicate with the parents frequently.
19. If a college student is busy with work, then the college student might not communicate with the parents frequently.
20. Everyone has a different relationship with the parents.
21. Constant communication might be a low priority for some people.
22. I would name the graph "Leaving the Nest Does not Need to Mean Losing Touch".
23. I have one last note.
24. I wonder about a change in the age range.
25. The age range is 18-34.
26. The age range could be reduced to only individuals in college.
27. The age range could be reduced to only individuals in their twenties.
28. If the age range is reduced, then these percentages might change.
29. It might be interesting to study smaller age ranges.
30. Some smaller age ranges encompass specific stages of people's lives.
31. If we look at a smaller age range, then people's interactions with their parents may change.
